channel.title: What is the difference?
channel.description:
[code]test.java:5: incomparable types: java.lang.String[] and java.lang.String if(args == "word") ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
So what exactly is the difference between java.lang.String[] and java.lang.String???

item.title: What is the difference?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:5, topic:124082”][quote author=javaNoob() link=topic=173935.msg1603818#msg1603818 date=1184671917]

test.java:5: incomparable types: java.lang.String[] and java.lang.String if(args == "word") ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

So what exactly is the difference between java.lang.String[] and java.lang.String???
[/quote]

You can only compare types of “Number” with compare operators, ==, != etc… For ALL other objects etc, such as strings you HAVE to use “.equals(withwhat)”[/quote]perhaps, but if you want to know if they are the same object in memory, you use the equality comparators

Read full topic

item.title: What is the difference?
item.dc:creator: @javaNoob javaNoob()
item.description:
@javaNoob wrote:

ok thanks, im trying to learn java

Read full topic

item.title: What is the difference?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

[quote=“javaNoob(), post:1, topic:124082”]test.java:5: incomparable types: java.lang.String[] and java.lang.String if(args == "word") ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

So what exactly is the difference between java.lang.String[] and java.lang.String???[/quote]

You can only compare types of “Number” with compare operators, ==, != etc… For ALL other objects etc, such as strings you HAVE to use “.equals(withwhat)”

Read full topic
